attributes.action: Provide compulsory counselling sessions in schools for young children
attributes.background: Providing compulsory sessions which enable children with mental disorders to be identified without having to seek help. Other kids will not know who requires help so they will feel more open to talking in their sessions. If mental issues are caught at an earlier age, quality of life is improved.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about mental health issues among young people but we aren't sure what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take.

Counselling is a treatment for mental health and emotional difficulties and usually follows after a problem has been identified. 

You might like to sign one of these petitions which call for more help with mental health problems for young people:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/228717

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/228007

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/227933
